intro: Rorippa curvipes, commonly known as the bent-leaf watercress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a small, annual herb that typically grows in wet or aquatic environments such as marshes, ditches, and ponds. The plant has slender, branching stems and small, alternate leaves that are often curved or twisted, giving it its common name. Its flowers are small, white or pale yellow, and arranged in clusters, typical of the mustard family. Rorippa curvipes is known for its ability to thrive in waterlogged soils and is often found in temperate regions across Europe and Asia.
